trans-unit.source: Provides user interface (UI) elements that enable a user to recover or reset a lost password and receive it in e-mail.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Views](#views) - [Styles and Templates](#styles_and_templates) - [Validation Groupings](#validation_groupings) - [Applying CSS Styles](#applying_styles) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The PasswordRecovery control assists users who have forgotten their passwords.
It enables a user to request an e-mail message containing either a new password or the password already associated with his or her user name.
> [!NOTE] > The PasswordRecovery Web control uses Internet e-mail services to send recovered or new passwords to users.
There are inherent security risks with sending passwords in e-mail.
You should determine whether these security risks are acceptable to your site.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the set of login controls available in ASP.NET, see [ASP.NET Login Controls Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) before continuing.
For a list of other topics related to login controls and membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Users can recover passwords only when the membership provider defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property supports clear text or encrypted passwords.
Because hashed passwords cannot be recovered, users at sites that use hashed passwords can only reset their passwords.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Accepting user input is a potential security threat.
Malicious users can send data that is intended to expose vulnerabilities or run programs that try generated passwords.
To improve security when working with user input, you should use the validation features of your control and secure any data providers that are configured for your control.

For more information, see [Securing Login Controls](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), [Basic Security Practices for Web Applications](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and [Securing Membership](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

> [!NOTE] > The PasswordRecovery control can be used when a membership user has not been approved (<xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser.IsApproved%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is set to `false`), but it cannot be used when a membership user has been locked out (<xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser.IsLockedOut%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is set to `true`).
The e-mail message is sent using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> class.
To be able to send e-mail to users, you must configure a mail server in your application's Web.config file.
You can change the content of the e-mail sent to users by setting a custom message in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MailDefinition%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > It is not possible to guarantee that a user will receive or view an e-mail message.
To verify that a user has received a notification by e-mail, consider providing a confirmation link in the message, allowing the user to confirm that the notification was received.
## Views The PasswordRecovery control has three states, or views: - UserName view -- Asks the user for his or her registered user name.
- Question view -- Requires the user to provide the answer to a stored question to reset the password.
- Success view -- Tells the user whether the password recovery or reset was successful.

The PasswordRecovery control displays the Question view only when the membership provider defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property supports password question and answer.
The following table lists each style property of the PasswordRecovery control and indicates which view it affects.

|Property|UserName view|Question view|Success view| |--------------|-------------------|-------------------|------------------| ||Yes|Yes|Yes| ||Yes|Yes|No| ||Yes|Yes|No| ||Yes|Yes|No| ||Yes|Yes|No| ||No|No|Yes| ||Yes|Yes|No| ||Yes|Yes|Yes| ## Styles and Templates You can use an extensive set of style properties to customize the appearance of the PasswordRecovery control.
Alternatively, you can apply custom templates to the three views if you need complete control over the appearance of the control.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessTemplate%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameTemplate%2A> properties to create templates for these views.
If you define a template for a view, the style properties of PasswordRecovery have no effect.
The following table lists the PasswordRecovery control style properties and explains which UI element each style property affects.
For a list of which properties each style applies to, see the documentation for the individual style properties.

|Style property|UI element affected| |--------------------|-------------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonStyle%2A>|Submit buttons on all views.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.FailureTextStyle%2A>|Error text displayed to the user.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HyperLinkStyle%2A>|Links to other pages.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.InstructionTextStyle%2A>|Instructional text on the page that tells users how to use the control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.LabelStyle%2A>|Labels for all input fields, such as text boxes.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.TextBoxStyle%2A>|Text entry input fields.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.TitleTextStyle%2A>|Title text for each view.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessTextStyle%2A>|Text displayed to the user when the password recovery or reset attempt is successful.| The following table lists which template properties apply to each view in the PasswordRecovery control.
For a list of the controls that you must set in each template, see the documentation for the individual template properties.

|View|Template property| |----------|-----------------------| |UserName|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameTemplate%2A>| |Question|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A>| |Success|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessTemplate%2A>| When the PasswordRecovery control is not customized with templates, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AccessKey%2A> property of the PasswordRecovery control applies to the first text box in the control and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.TabIndex%2A> property, which is applied to all text boxes of the control.

If the PasswordRecovery control is customized with templates, then the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AccessKey%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.TabIndex%2A> property are ignored.

In this case, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AccessKey%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.TabIndex%2A> property of each template child control directly.

PasswordRecovery control properties represented by text boxes, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.Answer%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.Question%2A>, are accessible during all phases of the page life cycle.
The control will pick up any changes made by the end user by means of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox.TextChanged> event triggered by the textboxes.

## Validation Groupings The PasswordRecovery control creates a validation group for all required field validators in the control so that other input controls on the page are not affected by validating the PasswordRecovery control.
By default, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of the PasswordRecovery control is used as the name of the validation group.
For example, a PasswordRecovery control with the ID "PasswordRecovery1" will use a validation group name of "PasswordRecovery1".
If you want the PasswordRecovery control to participate in another validation group, you must template the control.
## Applying CSS Styles The PasswordRecovery control lets you specify CSS style rules in markup.
If you use templates to customize the appearance of the PasswordRecovery control, you can specify CSS styles in the markup in the templates.
In that case, no extra outer table is required.
You can prevent the table from being rendered by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.RenderOuterTable%2A> property to `false`.

## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

## Declarative Syntax ```                                                                                                                                                                                                                     ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> class.
Gets the answer to the password recovery confirmation question entered by the user.
The Answer property contains the answer to the confirmation question entered by the user.
The Answer property is valid only after the page has been posted back to the server.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The answer to the password recovery confirmation question entered by the user.
Gets or sets the label text for the password confirmation answer text box.
The AnswerLabelText property contains the label text for the password recovery confirmation answer text box.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.LabelStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the text specified in the AnswerLabelText property.
If you assign a template in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A> property, the AnswerLabelText property has no effect.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The label for the password confirmation answer text box.
The default is "Answer:"
Occurs when the user enters an incorrect answer to the password recovery confirmation question.

The AnswerLookupError event is raised when the answer to the password recovery question is not validated by the membership provider defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property.
If the membership provider does not support password recovery question and answer, the AnswerLookupError event is never raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
Gets or sets the error message displayed to the user when the Answer text box is blank.

The AnswerRequiredErrorMessage contains the error message to display in any <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationSummary> control on the same page as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The error message displayed when the Answer text box is empty.
The default is "Answer."
Gets or sets the amount of padding inside the borders of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The value of the BorderPadding property is stored in view state.

The amount of space (in pixels) between the contents of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control and the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control's border.
The default value is 1.
The value of the BorderPadding property is set to less than -1.
Creates the individual controls that make up the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The CreateChildControls method creates instances of the controls that make up the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control and creates default event handlers for their events.
Gets a reference to a collection of properties that define the appearance of error text in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The FailureTextStyle property defines the appearance of error messages in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
This property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `FailureTextStyle-ForeColor`).
You can set the property programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `FailureTextStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The FailureTextStyle property defines the appearance of the following properties: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.GeneralFailureText%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionFailureText%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameFailureText%2A> The style settings for the FailureTextStyle property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
Any settings made in the FailureTextStyle property override the corresponding settings in properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> style properties are overridden by FailureTextStyle settings: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Enabled%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Font%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ForeColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Height%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ToolTip%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A> When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the FailureTextStyle property has no effect.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains properties that define the appearance of error text.
Gets or sets the error message to display when there is a problem with the membership provider for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.

The GeneralFailureText property is displayed to the user when there is a problem with the membership provider that manages user information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
Typically, the GeneralFailureText property is displayed when the membership provider cannot connect to the data store containing user information.

The text specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameFailureText%2A> property is displayed in the UserName view when the provider cannot find the specified user name in the database.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionFailureText%2A> property is displayed in the Question view when the answer entered by the user does not match the stored answer.
The GeneralFailureText property is displayed for all other errors.
The appearance of the GeneralFailureText property is defined by the style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.FailureTextStyle%2A> property.

When you set templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the GeneralFailureText property is displayed in an optional <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control with the control ID set to "FailureText".
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The error message displayed when the user's password will not be sent by e-mail because of a problem with the membership provider.
The default is "Your attempt to retrieve your password has failed.
Please try again."
Gets or sets the URL of an image to display next to the link to the Help page.
The URL of an image to display next to the link to the Help page.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the text of the link to the password recovery Help page.
The HelpPageText property contains the link text for the password recovery Help page.

If a URL is specified in the HelpPageText property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control displays a link to information about password recovery in the UserName view and the Question view, but not in the Success view.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HelpPageUrl%2A> property is set to <xref:System.String.Empty>, no link is displayed.
The appearance of the Help page link is defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HyperLinkStyle%2A> property.

When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the HelpPageText and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HelpPageUrl%2A> properties have no effect.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text of the link to the password recovery Help page.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets the URL of the password recovery Help page.
The HelpPageUrl property contains the URL of the password recovery Help page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control displays a link to the password recovery Help page in the UserName view and the Question view but not in the Success view.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HelpPageText%2A> property is set to <xref:System.String.Empty>, no link is displayed.
The appearance of the Help page link is defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HyperLinkStyle%2A> property.

When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HelpPageText%2A> and HelpPageUrl properties have no effect.
The URL of the password recovery Help page.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Gets a reference to a collection of properties that define the appearance of hyperlinks on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The HyperLinkStyle property defines the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.HelpPageText%2A> property.
This property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object it returns.

The properties can be set declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `HyperLinkStyle-ForeColor`).
You can also set the properties programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `HyperLinkStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.
The style settings for the HyperLinkStyle property are merged with <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control style settings.
Any settings made in the HyperLinkStyle property override the corresponding settings in properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

The following properties are overridden by HyperLinkStyle settings: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Enabled%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Font%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ForeColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Height%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ToolTip%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control's UserName view or Question view, the HyperLinkStyle property has no effect.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains the settings that define the appearance of hyperlinks.
Gets a reference to a collection of style properties that define the appearance of explanatory text in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The InstructionTextStyle property defines the appearance of explanatory text in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
This property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object it returns.

You can set the properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `InstructionTextStyle-ForeColor`).
You can also set the properties programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `InstructionTextStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The InstructionTextStyle property defines the appearance of the following properties: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionInstructionText%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameInstructionText%2A> Style settings made to the InstructionTextStyle property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
Any settings made in the InstructionTextStyle property override the corresponding settings in properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control properties are overridden by InstructionTextStyle properties: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Enabled%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Font%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ForeColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Height%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ToolTip%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A> When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control's UserName view or Question view, the InstructionTextStyle property has no effect.
A reference to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains properties that define the appearance of explanatory text.
Gets a reference to a collection of style properties that define the appearance of text box labels in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The LabelStyle property defines the appearance of text box labels in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
This property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object it returns.

You cans set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `LabelStyle-ForeColor`).
You can also set the properties programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `LabelStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The LabelStyle property defines the appearance of the following properties: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.AnswerLabelText%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionLabelText%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameLabelText%2A> Style settings made to the LabelStyle property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
Any settings made in the LabelStyle property override the corresponding settings in properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> properties are overridden by LabelStyle settings: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Enabled%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Font%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ForeColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Height%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ToolTip%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A> When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control's UserName view and Question view, the LabelStyle property has no effect.
A reference to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains properties that define the appearance of text box labels.
Implements the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadControlState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
An object that represents the control state to be restored.
Implements the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
An object that represents the control state to restore.
The view state is invalid.
Gets a reference to a collection of properties that define the characteristics of e-mail messages used to send new or recovered passwords to users.
A reference to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition"></xref> that contains properties that define the characteristics of e-mail messages used to send users their passwords.
Gets or sets the membership provider used to look up user information.
The MembershipProvider property identifies the membership provider used to verify user information entered in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
Membership providers are defined in the Web.config file in the <`membership`> section.
Setting the MembershipProvider property will change the provider used.
If you do not set the MembershipProvider property, it will always return <xref:System.String.Empty>.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The membership provider used to look up user information.
The default value is <xref:System.String>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.AnswerLookupError"></xref> event.
The OnAnswerLookupError method is called when the user's answer to the password recovery confirmation question does not match the answer stored in the Web site data store.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.AnswerLookupError> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The OnAnswerLookupError method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Determines whether the event for the server control is passed up the page's UI server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event has been canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Implements the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.OnInit%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The event data.
Implements the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.OnPreRender%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SendingMail"></xref> event.
The OnSendingMail method is called after the membership provider has verified that the user is a valid member of the Web site and before the recovered or new password is e-mailed to the user.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SendingMail> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The OnSendingMail method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SendMailError"></xref> event when an e-mail message cannot be sent to the user.
The OnSendMailError method is called when the SMTP Mail service throws an exception.

The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SendMailError> error and, if the exception is not handled, rethrows the exception while maintaining the call stack.

Examine the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SendMailErrorEventArgs.Exception%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SendMailErrorEventArgs> object passed as the `e` parameter to determine the actual cause of the exception.

During development, the most common reason that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SendMailError> event is raised is that the `<smtpMail>` section of the Web.config file is incorrect.
After deployment, this event can occur for a variety of reasons, most having to do with errors in an email address.

You must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SendMailErrorEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the object passed as the `e` parameter to `true` to signal that the exception has been handled; otherwise, the exception is thrown again.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Server Event Handling in ASP.NET Web Forms Pages](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnSendMailError method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SendMailErrorEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserLookupError"></xref> event.
The OnUserLookupError method is called when the membership provider is unable to find the user name entered on the initial screen.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserLookupError> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The OnUserLookupError method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.VerifyingAnswer"></xref> event.
The OnVerifyingAnswer method is called before the user's answer to the password recovery confirmation question is sent to the membership provider to be verified.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.VerifyingAnswer> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The OnVerifyingAnswer method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.VerifyingUser"></xref> event.
The OnVerifyingUser method is called after the user submits a user name on the initial screen and before the user name is validated by the membership provider.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.VerifyingUser> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The OnVerifyingUser method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> that contains the event data.
Gets the password recovery confirmation question established by the user on the Web site.
The Question property contains the password recovery confirmation question that the user previously established on the Web site.
The Question property is displayed only in the Question view.

If the membership provider specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property does not support password question and answer, the Question view is not displayed and the Question property is not used.
The membership provider returns the question only after the user enters a valid user name.
Until the user enters a valid user name, the Question property is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.TextBoxStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the Question property.

When you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A> property to define the appearance of the Question view, the Question property is displayed in an optional <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property set to "Question".
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The password recovery confirmation question.
The default value is <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets the text to display when the user's answer to the password recovery confirmation question does not match the answer stored in the Web site data store.

The QuestionFailureText property contains the error message that is displayed when the answer to the password recovery confirmation question does not match the answer stored in the Web site data store.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.FailureTextStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the QuestionFailureText property.

When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the QuestionFailureText property is displayed in an optional <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property set to "FailureText".
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text to display when the user's answer to the password recovery confirmation question does not match the answer stored in the Web site data store.
The default value is "Your answer could not be verified.
Please try again."
Gets or sets the text to display in the Question view to instruct the user to answer the password recovery confirmation question.
The QuestionInstructionText property is displayed in Question view to instruct the user to answer the password recovery confirmation question.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.InstructionTextStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the QuestionInstructionText property.
When you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A> property to define the appearance of the Question view, the QuestionInstructionText property has no effect.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The instruction text to display in the Question view.
The default is "Answer the following question to receive your password."
Gets or sets the text of the label for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.Question*> text box.
The QuestionLabelText property contains the label text for the password recovery confirmation question text box.
The style settings contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.LabelStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the QuestionLabelText property.
When you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A> property to define the appearance of the Question view, the QuestionLabelText property has no effect.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The label for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.Question*> text box.
The default is "Question:"
Gets or sets the template used to display the Question view of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The QuestionTemplate property contains the template that defines the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control in Question view.
The following table lists the required and optional controls used in the Question view template.

|ID or Command name|Control type|Required/optional| |------------------------|------------------|------------------------| |`Answer`|Any control that implements <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl>.|Required| |`Submit`|Any control that causes event bubbling.|Optional| The Submit control can be any control that causes event bubbling, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton>.
The control's command name property must be set to "Submit".
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception if the Question view does not contain the required controls.

No exception is thrown if you give an optional control ID to a control of the wrong type; however, the control is subsequently ignored by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

When you use a template to define the appearance of the Question view, only the following properties affect the behavior of the control: - All properties inherited from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> (for details, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control members table).
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.Answer%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.GeneralFailureText%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MailDefinition%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.Question%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionFailureText%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessPageUrl%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessTemplate%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserName%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameFailureText%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameTemplate%2A>.
All other properties are inactive when you use a template for the Question view.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> that contains the template for displaying the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control in Question view.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Gets the container that a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control used to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate*> template.
This property provides programmatic access to child controls.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate*> template.
Gets or sets the title for the Question view of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The QuestionTitleText property contains the text to display as the title of the Question view, which asks the user to answer the password confirmation question.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.TitleTextStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the text in the QuestionTitleText property.
When you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A> property to define the appearance of the Question view, the QuestionTitleText property has no effect.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The title for the Question view.
The default is "Identity Confirmation".
Writes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref> content to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object, for display on the client.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that receives the rendered output.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control encloses rendered HTML in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_table" name="table" href=""></xref> element in order to apply inline styles.

In order to make inline style properties such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ForeColor%2A> apply to all the HTML that is rendered for the control, ASP.NET encloses the rendered HTML in a `table` element.
If you do not want the outer `table` element to be rendered, set this property to `false`.
In that case, if you try to set inline style properties that apply to the whole control, an exception is thrown.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control encloses rendered HTML in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_table" name="table" href=""></xref> element; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Saves any server control state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
Returns the server control's current state.
If there is no state associated with the control, this method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Saves any state that was modified after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.TrackViewState*> method was invoked.
An object that contains the current view state of the control; otherwise, if there is no view state associated with the control, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Occurs before the user is sent a password in e-mail.

The SendingMail event occurs on the server after the user requests a new or recovered password and submits a correct answer to the password confirmation question (if your membership provider supports password question and answer), but before the password is sent to the user in e-mail.
Use this event to do any special processing required before sending the e-mail message, such as setting <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> properties.

After the user enters a valid user name and, if relevant, a valid answer, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control raises the SendingMail event, and then sends the password information to the user in e-mail.
The e-mail uses the settings defined in the `<smtpMail>` configuration file element.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
Occurs when the SMTP Mail system throws an error while attempting to send an e-mail message.
The SendMailError event is raised when the SMTP mail server throws an exception when trying to send an e-mail message.
The default SendMailError event does not handle the SMTP error from the mail system.

The method that handles the SendMailError event must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SendMailErrorEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SendMailErrorEventArgs> object to `true` to handle the error and prevent it from being displayed to the user.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Implements the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.System%23Web%23UI%23IControlDesignerAccessor%23SetDesignModeState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The design-time data for the control.
Represents the command to perform when the Submit button is clicked.
This field is a string that represents the command to perform when the Submit button is clicked.
The default is "Submit".
This field is read-only.

If you use a template with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, you must use this command name for the action performed to submit the form or the control will not function properly.
To be added.
Gets or sets the URL of an image to use as the Submit button.

The SubmitButtonImageUrl property contains the URL of the image to use for the Submit button when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonType%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonText%2A> property is used as the alternative text for the image in browsers that do not display images.

When you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameTemplate%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionTemplate%2A> property, the SubmitButtonImageUrl property has no effect.
The URL of the image to use as the Submit button.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Gets a reference to a collection of properties that define the appearance of Submit buttons in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The SubmitButtonStyle property defines the appearance of Submit buttons in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
This property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `SubmitButtonStyle-ForeColor`).
You can also set the properties programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `SubmitButtonStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.
The style settings for the SubmitButtonStyle property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
Any settings made in the SubmitButtonStyle property override the corresponding settings in properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> properties are overridden by SubmitButtonStyle settings: - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Enabled%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Font%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ForeColor%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Height%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ToolTip%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> - <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Width%2A> When you use templates to define the appearance of the initial or Question view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the SubmitButtonStyle property has no effect.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that contains properties that define the appearance of the Submit buttons.
Gets or sets the text of the button that submits the form.
The SubmitButtonText property contains the text displayed for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control's Submit button.
How the SubmitButtonText property is used depends on the setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonType%2A> property.
For details, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonType%2A>.
When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the SubmitButtonText property has no effect.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text of the button.
The default is "Submit".
Gets or sets the type of Submit button to use when rendering the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The SubmitButtonType property determines what kind of button is used to submit entries to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
The following table lists the button type used for each value of the SubmitButtonType property.
|SubmitButtonType value|Button used| |----------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType>|A standard HTML button.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonText%2A> property provides the text for the button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType>|The image at the location stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonImageUrl%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonText%2A> property provides the alternate text for the image.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType>|An HTML link.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SubmitButtonText%2A> property provides the link text.| When you use templates to define the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control, the SubmitButtonType property has no effect.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref>.
The SubmitButtonType property is not set to a valid <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the URL of the page to display after sending a password successfully.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to display the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control in a horizontal or vertical layout.
The TextLayout property specifies where the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control displays the field labels for the Answer, Question, and User Name text boxes.
When the TextLayout property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginTextLayout> (the default), the field labels appear to the left of the text boxes.
When TextLayout is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginTextLayout>, the field labels appear above the text boxes.

The text of the labels is specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.AnswerLabelText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.QuestionLabelText%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameLabelText%2A> properties, respectively.
The style settings for the field labels are specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.LabelStyle%2A> property.

Gets or sets the text that appears in the User Name text box.
The UserName property contains the user name entered by the user, or <xref:System.String> if the user has not entered a name.
The UserName property is used only in the UserName view.

The UserName property is saved in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control's control state to preserve the values between round trips to the server even when view state is turned off for the page.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control properties represented by text boxes, such as UserName, are accessible during all phases of the page life cycle.
The control will pick up any changes made by the end user by means of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox.TextChanged> event triggered by the textboxes.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.TextBoxStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the text in the UserName property.

When you assign a template to the UserName property to display the UserName view, the UserName property is assigned the value entered in a required <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property set to "UserName".
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The user name entered by the user.
The default value is <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets the text displayed when the user name entered by the user is not a valid user name for the Web site.

The UserNameFailureText property contains the error message that is displayed when the user enters a user name that is not recognized by the membership provider defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.FailureTextStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the text in the UserNameFailureText property.

When you assign a template to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameTemplate%2A> property, the UserNameFailureText property is displayed in an optional <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property set to "FailureText".
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text displayed when the user name entered by the user is not a valid user name for the Web site.
The default is "We were unable to access your information.
Please try again."

The UserNameInstructionText property is displayed in the UserName view to explain to the user how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
The style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.InstructionTextStyle%2A> property define the appearance of the text in the UserNameInstructionText property.
When using a template assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameTemplate%2A> property, the UserNameInstructionText property is not displayed.
The default text for the property is localized based on the server's locale setting.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The instruction text to display in the UserName view.
The default is "Enter your user name to receive your password."

Gets or sets the template used to display the UserName view of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
The UserNameTemplate property contains the template that defines the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control in UserName view.
The following table lists the required and optional controls used in the UserName view template.

|ID or Command name|Control type|Required/optional| |------------------------|------------------|------------------------| |`UserName`|Any control that implements <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl>.|Optional| |`Submit`|Any control that causes event bubbling.|Optional| The Submit control can be any control that causes event bubbling, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton>.
The control's `CommandName` property must be set to "Submit".
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception if the UserName view does not contain the required controls.

No exception is thrown if you give an optional control ID to a control of the wrong type; however, the control is subsequently ignored by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

When you use a template to define the appearance of the UserName view, only the following properties affect the behavior of the control: - All properties inherited from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> (see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control members table).
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.GeneralFailureText%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MailDefinition%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessPageUrl%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SuccessTemplate%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserName%2A>.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.UserNameFailureText%2A>.
All other properties are inactive when you use a template for the UserName view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> that contains the template for displaying the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control in UserName view.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Occurs when the user has submitted an answer to the password recovery confirmation question.
The VerifyingAnswer event occurs on the server after the user submits the answer to the password confirmation question.
You can use this event to prepare the answer submitted by the user for the membership provider, for example by converting it to all uppercase or lowercase letters.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control first raises the VerifyingAnswer event, and then uses the membership provider specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property to compare the answer entered by the user with the password stored in the Web site.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
To be added.
Occurs before the user name is validated by the membership provider.
The VerifyingUser event is raised on the server before the user name is submitted to the membership provider to determine whether the user name is valid.

Use this event to perform any preprocessing needed on the user name, such as converting it to all uppercase or lowercase letters, or verifying that the user name is in a particular format, such as an e-mail address.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control first raises the VerifyingUser event, and then uses the membership provider specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.MembershipProvider%2A> property to determine whether the user name entered is a valid user name for the Web site.

If it is valid, and the membership provider supports password question and answer, the password verification question is returned from the Web site and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control displays the Question view.

If the user name is not valid, the text in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.GeneralFailureText%2A> property is displayed in the UserName view so that the user can enter a different user name.

If the membership provider does not support password question and answer, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery.SendingMail> event is raised and e-mail is sent to the user with the new or recovered password.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
To be added.
